captions.text: You couldn't have peed before you went under?
This rain is no good for the mission.
You're gonna have to pee your pants
I'm not going to pee my pants.

Are you crazy? We were sitting in first
class up there.

Letting your subconscious change the environment of the dream is
dangerous.
You pee your pants right now.

This is a very delicate mission we
cannot let our personal feelings get in the way.

Just do what I do and everything will
be-- (crash)
Well I don't have to pee anymore.
Where the blazes did a train come from??
Who may also try and kill us.
a train that will take you far away..
you know where you hope the train will take you but you can't know for sure!

You just said don't let your personal
feelings get in the way.
Look, I know what I said
It's okay, got it under control.
Wait, what is this? Whats happening?

Sometimes I think about the ladies when I 
dream.
I can't help it man, it's my subconscious.
He's just a guy I know... sorry!
Well, this is all becoming very distracting.

Not as distracting as that noise of
course.
I am beginning to have anxiety
I often dream that I am in my underpants when I get nervous.
Come on guys, we are professionals!
Everyone get a hold of yourselves okay?
Okay... looks like we're good to go
Get outta my head you criminals!
Limbo!! How low can you go? How low can you go??

comments.text:

comments.author: RedSpawN

comments.text:
+brian head no, the negative comments are that the characters aren't that 
strong, the dialogue is just explaining things and yes, for some the story 
is too complicated, which can be a problem. Just because your movie is 
difficult to understand doesn't make it good, in fact, it can have quite 
the opposite effect. While I personally do like the movie (I don't think 
it's great though), I can understand why some people don't like it, and 
it's not because they're too stupid or anything like that. And all the 
people who say "you just don't get it" can go to hell, because everyone is 
allowed to have their own opinion without people calling them dumb because 
they don't share the same opinion.

They are hardly the stupidest movies ever made, but they are some of the 
dumbest movies to get that much critical acclaim while getting exact 
opposite reviews from reviewers and the informed public. At least in the 
past decade. Obviously I'd put many of the Transformers movies in that 
venue as well.

If you wanted to go with the dumbest movie, in a genre that's not supposed 
to be dumb, I would go with Highlander 2: The Quickening. There are many 
even dumber movies, but very few take themselves that seriously.

comments.text:
+Madamoiselle X
there was gravity in the snowdream because it was a deeper level..the 
feeling of loss of gravity goes to the immediate lower level from the upper 
level so in this case when  the van ( in level 1) was falling the loss of 
gravity went to the hotel as it was in level 2...the snowdream is on level 
3 which is a much more deeper level..so the loss of gravity wears off at 
this level..Cobb also explains to Ariadne that in reality the flight is 10 
hours....So on Level 1 the time is 1 week....on Level 2 the time is 6 
months ...and on level 3 the time is 10 years!!!..so as time is extended as 
we go deeper down the dream levels, the effects of gravity are also extended
comments.author: Yoyo Mofo

comments.author: Young Discord

comments.text:
+Fauxpikachu What i meant was that instead of being subtle you can just 
manipulate the person in the right way so that you don't have to be... 
there's no reason to take the long way around if you can just take the 
straight road if you spend some time looking for it instead of figuring out 
a way around, just tell the guy it's a dream, that way he'll dismiss 
ANYTHING that will happen in it because he'll assume it's all a part of a 
dream rather than actual real people invading his dream, after all he's 
more likely to believe the whole thing rather than the concept of an actual 
person entering another's dream, in fact if you'd just flat out tell him in 
the dream about this I'd say there's a 0%chance he'll believe you because 
anything can happen in a dream ANYTHING, even a person coming up to you and 
telling you that he's a real person who entered your dream, even in real 
life if they'd want him to believe them they'd have to PROVE it to him, 
people are very stubborn creatures that's all I'm saying, they didn't have 
to be subtle at all.
comments.author: Young Discord

comments.text:
+Young Discord Not exactly, they started that tactic on the second dream 
only because they found out he was trained. It was a sort of last resort. 
Planting an idea is a very subtle process as they say. You can't rush it or 
just do it in one go. You have to work with layers, if there weren't any 
hostile projections, they would have done it in a more composed way, 
ensuring their success rate.
comments.author: Fauxpikachu

comments.text:
+Fauxpikachu Exactly so why the hell not just go full retard on it, that 
will make him in turn go full retard and have him help them even more, BAM 
instant success
comments.author: Young Discord

comments.text:
+Young Discord - The guy was trained for extractions. He was aware of the 
concept of entering dreams.
- They do reveal to him that he's in a dream in order to turn him against 
his own subconscious.
comments.author: Fauxpikachu

comments.text:
+George Roman its true, what you say makes a lot of sense, but in the movie 
the concept of going into someone else's dream was an obscure one and if 
you'd tell someone that you could enter their dreams they' dismiss it as a 
joke until you actually showed them, furthermore if you suddenly entered 
their dream and told them that they still wouldn't believe you and would 
dismiss it as part of your dreams, we don't always understand everything in 
our dreams so it's only natural that sometimes we encounter in our dreams 
something that we might consider as not a part of that dream and therefore 
I personally don't think it would have been a big deal if they'd just have 
been open about all this in his dream in the first place instead of doing 
this elaborate plan
comments.author: Young Discord

comments.text:
Yea, it's been a while since I've watched it... i might have worded it 
wrong. The target itself wasn't supposed to be aware of the fact that he 
has been infiltrated, I'm pretty sure that they explain this in some way in 
the movie. I remember not being left in the dark on this matter, after 
watching the movie.
comments.author: George Roman

comments.text:
+George Roman Dude, his subconscious was aware of them the moment they were 
being attacked, that's why they were attacked in the first place, in fact 
they were attacked in each successive dream, using your logic, they had 
already failed in the very first dream... then in the next and in the next 
after that... plus if they would go out of their way to do something 
abstract like using superpowers it would convince the client even more that 
he's dreaming and make him dismiss even more stuff that was going on which 
would make it even easier for them to implant the idea in his head, hell at 
that point they could probably flat out say it to his face in the first 
dream, if I'd have an insane psychotic dream with insane shit going down 
and then a dude tells me: you got to sell your firm because your dying 
father wants you to ork for your own success, I'd just straight off assume 
that that was my subsoncious telling me to do that and I'd go and do just 
that when I wake up... less danger, easier to do and they can be way more 
careless with everything...
comments.author: Young Discord

comments.text:
Altering the perceived reality of their target would have made their 
target's subconscious aware of them, and as a result, lead them to fail the 
mission.
comments.author: George Roman

comments.text: Well I'm glad we all learned from this.
comments.author: Tate Hildyard

comments.text:
I must admit it was a bit rash on my part to jump right in and throw around 
such offensive language. I suppose my emotions got the best of me. I 
appreciate both of you gentlemen for being so understanding. I have learned 
alot from both of you, and from now on I will most certainly not be so 
crude.
comments.author: bill clinton
